title: Fear and confusion, but not chaos, along the southern border after Title 42 ends
description: The pandemic-era policy nearly halted the processing of asylum applications. As Title 42 was lifted on Thursday, officials braced for an influx of migrants. But the reality was relatively calm.

title: Turkey's opposition leader poses a challenge to President Erdogan
description: Journalist Ruth Michaelson talks about Turkish opposition leader Kemal Kiliçdaroglu ahead of Turkey's general election.

title: Biden pledged to stop funding fossil fuels overseas. It's not stopping one agency
description: Leaders of the Export-Import Bank of the United States voted Thursday to help fund the expansion of an oil refinery in Indonesia.

title: Daniel Penny arraigned in chokehold death of Jordan Neely
description: Daniel Penny, the 24-year-old man who put Jordan Neely in a fatal chokehold on the New York City subway last week, faces manslaughter charges.

title: FDA changes rules for donating blood. Some say they're still discriminatory
description: Pathologist Dr. Benjamin Mazer talks about the changing FDA rules on donating blood for men who have sex with men.

title: Teachers in Arizona tap the power of plants to teach kids resilience
description: Kids at a Flagstaff, Arizona, elementary school have been through a lot since 2019: the pandemic, and then wildfires and a big flood. Teachers are using horticulture therapy to teach them resilience.

title: Meet the school custodian who has coached the chess team to the championships
description: Queen's Gambit? More like Bishop's Gambit! (That joke will make sense when you learn his name is Dave Bishop.)

title: Jury reaches a verdict in Lori Vallow Daybell murder trial
description: A jury has reached a verdict in the trial of Vallow Daybell, who is accused of murdering two of her children and conspiring to kill a romantic rival. The verdict is set to be read at 2:45 p.m. ET.

title: Hodding Carter III, State Department spokesman during Iran hostage crisis, dies at 88
description: Carter was a Mississippi journalist and civil rights activist who as State Department spokesman informed Americans about the Iran hostage crisis and later won awards for his televised documentaries.

title: Daniel Penny is charged with second-degree manslaughter in the death of Jordan Neely
description: The former U.S. Marine, 24, was videotaped putting Neely in a chokehold on the NYC subway on May 1. He surrendered to police ahead of his arraignment on Friday and was released on $100,000 bail.

title: A former U.S. Army general predicts 'successful' Ukrainian offensive
description: Ex-U.S. Army Europe commanding Gen. Ben Hodges predicts success for Ukraine's long-awaited counterattack against Russia

title: Coronavirus FAQ: 'Emergency' over! Do we unmask and grin? Or adjust our worries?
description: Now that official COVID emergency declarations have ended, how should people evaluate their risk of SARS-CoV-2? That's the subject of our frequently asked questions offering.

title: George Santos confessed to stealing checks in Brazil in a deal to drop charges
description: The New York Republican congressman reached a deal with Brazilian prosecutors in which he agreed to confess and pay restitution and fines to avoid prosecution.

title: A Pakistani court orders former Prime Minister Imran Khan to be released on bail
description: A Pakistani court has granted former Prime Minister Imran Khan bail in multiple cases against him, allowing for his release following his dramatic arrest earlier this week.

title: How businesses are using designated areas to help lactating mothers
description: The recently enacted PUMP Act requires most employers to provide private lactation spaces, but does not provide monetary support to do so.

title: Victor LaValle's novel 'Lone Women' is infused with dread and horror — and more
description: This is a wonderful novel that expertly combines adventure and terror, sprinkled with The Changeling author's mordant wit and assured prose. It is a horror novel, but it's also a refreshing western.

title: One way to prevent gun violence? Treat it as a public health issue
description: Dr. Deborah Prothrow-Stith has spent decades framing violence as a public health issue. She spoke to Morning Edition about how guns fit into that picture and what prevention would look like.

title: As some families learn the hard way, dementia can take a toll on financial health
description: Reckless behavior with money can be a warning sign of cognitive decline — and the condition can put people at risk of financial ruin. There are few institutional safeguards in place.

title: In Tennessee, Black immigrants navigate a tricky course to a coveted driver's license
description: Being able to drive makes life easier. It can open up job opportunities. But it also has challenges, especially if there's a language barrier. And traffic stops can be especially high stakes.

title: A new film explains how the smartphone market slipped through BlackBerry's hands
description: This smartly entertaining new movie tells the story of how the BlackBerry became the hottest personal handheld device on the market — only to get crushed by the iPhone.

title: Turkey's president has built vast power over 20 years. But he may lose on Sunday
description: A struggling economy and slow earthquake response add up to a tough election for President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who has dominated Turkish politics for the past 20 years.

title: Republican Sen. Bill Cassidy wants to save Social Security. Will Washington let him?
description: The Louisiana Republican has been quietly working to build consensus around a bipartisan plan to address coming solvency issues with Social Security. So far, party leaders aren't listening.

title: Companies are shedding office space — and it may be killing small businesses
description: With so many people still working from home, companies are cutting back on office space. That spells trouble for small businesses that depend on foot traffic.

title: Norfolk Southern railcars derail in Pennsylvania, but with no hazardous chemicals
description: No injuries were reported after nine railcars from a Norfolk Southern freight train derailed in Pennsylvania, with no hazardous chemicals on board, fire department and company officials said.

title: Lainey Wilson and Chris Stapleton triumph at Academy of Country Music Awards
description: Lainey Wilson won album of the year for Bell Bottom Country and Chris Stapleton was named entertainer of the year at the Academy of Country Music Awards.

title: More gay and bisexual men will now be able to donate blood under finalized FDA rules
description: While the number of people eligible to donate blood has expanded, the agency says it will continue to monitor the safety of the blood supply.
